title: Pressure levels collection Met Office UKV 2km deterministic forecast

geopotential_height_on_pressure_levels.title: Geopotential height of the pressure levels
geopotential_height_on_pressure_levels.description: Note: from January 2026, this parameter will replace height_ASL_on_pressure_levels.

height_ASL_on_pressure_levels.title: Height above sea level of the pressure levels
height_ASL_on_pressure_levels.description: Note: from January 2026, this parameter will be replaced by geopotential_height_on_pressure_levels.

relative_humidity_on_pressure_levels.title: Fractional relative humidity on pressure levels.
relative_humidity_on_pressure_levels.description: Ratio of the partial pressure of water vapour to the equilibrium vapour pressure of water.

wet_bulb_potential_temperature_on_pressu.title: Wet bulb potential temperature on pressure levels
wet_bulb_potential_temperature_on_pressu.description: Wet bulb potential temperature is defined as the temperature that a parcel of air would have if it were brought down to the standard pressure of 1000hPa following a saturated adiabatic lapse rate. Available on levels: 85000.0, 70000.0, 50000.0 Pa

wind_direction_on_pressure_levels.title: Wind direction on pressure levels
wind_direction_on_pressure_levels.description: Wind direction on pressure levels is defined as a two-dimensional (horizontal) air velocity vector with no vertical component. In meteorological reports the direction of the wind vector is given as the direction from which it is blowing.

wind_speed_on_pressure_levels.title: Wind speed on pressure levels
wind_speed_on_pressure_levels.description: Wind speed on pressure levels is defined as a two-dimensional (horizontal) air velocity vector with no vertical component. The speed is the magnitude of velocity.
